channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Who was Hezbollah leader Haytham Ali Tabatabai, killed in Israeli strike on Lebanon?
Canada to overhaul citizenship rules: Will it benefit Indians?
What US ‘terrorist’ tag for Venezuelan cartel means for Maduro
Has Trump’s Doge experiment come to an abrupt end?
Quicksplained: Who is Nicholas Singh, the Indian-origin ‘most-wanted’ criminal, arrested in Canada?
Who is Wing Commander Afshan, wife of fighter pilot Namansh Syal, who died in Tejas crash?
US Sutra | Trump-Mamdani meet: Temporary truce or political theatre?
item.description: Politics is the art of deal-making. Not only Trump, but it appears his socialist critic and rival Mamdani too, is good at it

item.title: View from Abroad | Revisiting ‘Macaulayism’ through Tilak’s vision: India’s right to choose its own education model
item.description: It is up to Indians to decide what kind of education they want for their children. The Macaulay model is still alive and well, but the national model is also a viable alternative

item.title: When a neighbour implodes: Mapping the Hasina verdict in India’s calculus
item.description: The smart policy is to blend principle with prudence while dealing with Bangladesh

item.title: Why Japan’s Sanae Takaichi must be firm yet cautious on China and Taiwan
item.description: Japan must lead with principled resolve in a precarious situation. Tokyo should stand tall, not in isolation, but as a pillar of a free and open Indo-Pacific

item.title: Rajasthan’s Jalore: A medieval fort town set for an inland port makeover
item.description: A 262-km waterway linking Jalore to the Gulf of Kutch will revive an old medieval trade route

item.title: How deep-sea fishing can help India and Sri Lanka resolve the Palk Bay dispute
item.description: Deep-sea fishing isn’t just a matter of policy reform; it is the only sustainable, long-term solution to the Palk Bay dispute
